intro: Stewartia sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese stewartia, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its ornamental foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves that turn yellow in autumn. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer, adding visual interest to the landscape. The plant is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
